title: >>> NAUGTHY NOVEMBER
body_text:
"Undefeated v. Defeated"
3-0 Edwards takes on 0-5 Carty
"Crazy"
Mike Edwards
puts his unblemished record on the line against the ultra-athletic, yet extremely unlucky
Derek Carty
.
On paper, things certainly appear one-sided.
EDWARDS
He's terminated the reigns of two of the most recognized stars in feared southpaw Kevin Megill and the agile, athletically-gifted Michael Butler. He was one-third of the successful DODGEBALL 100 trio along with co-captains Justin Pierce and Kevin Adams. Could you imagine the sheer disappointment and utter shock if he falls in this forthcoming match-up against the most losing captain in history?
CARTY
This chance, this one opportunity could end the streak of consecutive losses ushering a new beginning for the high-flyin' dodger. Can the award-winning all-star finally make it to the win column? Will the years of embarrassment finally be laid to rest?
Mike Edwards v. Derek Carty
... the rush of adrenaline, non-stop pure athleticism is what it's all about. Catch it live at Wall High School November 17.
~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~
The Earnest Eleventh (Part 1)
November: The game's most wild, unpredictable month!
DODGEBALL XONE : 11/04/05
The beginning of Season 2, the dawning of a new era - the "Era of Devolution"! DODGEBALL XONE proved that even the so-called "legends" weren't always on top of the food chain. A group of young stallions lead by Kyle Carty would earn their stripes in a hard fought draw against literally, the biggest man to ever compete, Mike "Rozz" Rosinski. The intensity of this epic encounter drew in an incredible 33 competitors, setting a brand new attendance record.
*
Major Debuts
: Sara DeCuir, Lenny Herrera.
DODGEBALL XTWO : 11/05/05
Dodgeball's 12th extravaganza would go on to shatter the attendance record set just one night before with an astounding 42. The new number would stand atop the history books for nearly eight months.
*
Major Debuts
: Lauren Stopa, Zach Katz, Kevin Fitzpatrick.
Over the course of the next three weeks, the sport would hit its biggest numbers all in succession, averaging over 35 competitors per week. With arrivals of such future headliners like Robert Brown (13), Wesley Hebrew (XIV), Christina Guarino (15), Matt Brown (15), and Ryan Letsche (15), dodgeball was taken to new heights in an instant.
Other notable occurences include: Jim Martin breaking his ankle; Derek Carty's bad luck begins with a loss to Ben Cotta; dodgeball's first "V Shot" fiercely delivered to Kristen Driscoll by Sara DeCuir; the final Ocean Road Park event, DODGEBALL 15, during the original run.
........
With the highly anticipated
Edwards/Carty
clash and
WALL v. ALL 4
looming, it's safe to say November 2007 won't be hard to remember.
Check back next week as we take a look back at November 2006 - my how times had changed!
body_html:
"Undefeated v. Defeated"
3-0 Edwards takes on 0-5 Carty

"Crazy" Mike Edwards puts his unblemished record on the line against the ultra-athletic, yet extremely unlucky Derek Carty.

On paper, things certainly appear one-sided.

EDWARDS
He's terminated the reigns of two of the most recognized stars in feared southpaw Kevin Megill and the agile, athletically-gifted Michael Butler. He was one-third of the successful DODGEBALL 100 trio along with co-captains Justin Pierce and Kevin Adams. Could you imagine the sheer disappointment and utter shock if he falls in this forthcoming match-up against the most losing captain in history?

CARTY
This chance, this one opportunity could end the streak of consecutive losses ushering a new beginning for the high-flyin' dodger. Can the award-winning all-star finally make it to the win column? Will the years of embarrassment finally be laid to rest?

Mike Edwards v. Derek Carty ... the rush of adrenaline, non-stop pure athleticism is what it's all about. Catch it live at Wall High School November 17.


~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~ ~

The Earnest Eleventh (Part 1)
November: The game's most wild, unpredictable month!

DODGEBALL XONE : 11/04/05
The beginning of Season 2, the dawning of a new era - the "Era of Devolution"! DODGEBALL XONE proved that even the so-called "legends" weren't always on top of the food chain. A group of young stallions lead by Kyle Carty would earn their stripes in a hard fought draw against literally, the biggest man to ever compete, Mike "Rozz" Rosinski. The intensity of this epic encounter drew in an incredible 33 competitors, setting a brand new attendance record.
*Major Debuts: Sara DeCuir, Lenny Herrera.

DODGEBALL XTWO : 11/05/05
Dodgeball's 12th extravaganza would go on to shatter the attendance record set just one night before with an astounding 42. The new number would stand atop the history books for nearly eight months.
*Major Debuts: Lauren Stopa, Zach Katz, Kevin Fitzpatrick.

Over the course of the next three weeks, the sport would hit its biggest numbers all in succession, averaging over 35 competitors per week. With arrivals of such future headliners like Robert Brown (13), Wesley Hebrew (XIV), Christina Guarino (15), Matt Brown (15), and Ryan Letsche (15), dodgeball was taken to new heights in an instant.

Other notable occurences include: Jim Martin breaking his ankle; Derek Carty's bad luck begins with a loss to Ben Cotta; dodgeball's first "V Shot" fiercely delivered to Kristen Driscoll by Sara DeCuir; the final Ocean Road Park event, DODGEBALL 15, during the original run.

........

With the highly anticipated Edwards/Carty clash and WALL v. ALL 4 looming, it's safe to say November 2007 won't be hard to remember.

Check back next week as we take a look back at November 2006 - my how times had changed!
